documents.document:
Air guitar and the vicar...

Having just read a blog by a good duck and friend of mine, I was reminded of my most recent wedding (there's been two thus far, but I'll stop at two, thank you very much).

During one of the hymns, the vicar and myself were both told off. For playing air-guitar.

By Mrs Jakey-elect...

During the hymn. In the middle of our wedding...

Football. Gas. And the meaning of life

So Man U lost today. So the Reds will lift the Premiership again, the hard way. Again...

Now, I am too p155ed to type deep "fill a sock ickle" thoughts... AND there will be soccer related terms in the following diatribe....

I first saw Man United at Old Trafford in 1966, the days of Bestie, Dennis Law, Bobby, Nobby et al., and ever since then my life has been blighted.

Because I lived in Bristol, my Dad, knowing that footie was important to a lad (despite him being a rugby-head) took me to the closest League ground - my belov√©d Bristol Rovers FC.

So what chance do I have? Just another Man U-loving Gas-head. There are a lot of us...
...but footie RULES.

Today I am 3 pints less sober than I was 2 hours ago, which for me is a LOT. When I was younger (started regular drinking at age 15), single figures in a night was a failure, but nowadays, with family, music (yay! music!!!), less funds, and such other excuses, I hardly hit the sauce at all.

But I digress. The meaning of life, as I apply it to the alleged Beautiful Game is what I discussed with my 80+ -yr-old neighbour, as I was on the way to the pub, he was on his way to the bookie. (He was betting on a Chelski win, I hoped we'd clinch the Premiership at the Bridge)

Why do I love footie so much if all it brings is heartache? Because
1) it is what EVERY footie fan does
2) occasionally it becomes worthwhile.
There was a game recently. Man U (obviously) played a supreme match. No fouls, no petty diving (Diego Drogba, you could be a good player is you let your FOOTBALL do the talking - not your babylike whining, diving, CHEATING antics. And before you all shout back, yeah, Ronaldo too... but also Torres, most Arse players, anyone surnamed Cole, especially if you do the wild thing to some bint whilst married to a member of Girls Aloud - hellooo!!! Ashley, you Tw@t)

I will try that paragraff again

There was a game recently. Man U (obviously) played a supreme match. No fouls, no petty diving. just beautifully crafted soccer, with flowing skills, a few goals (I believe that Man U scored 2, which was more than the other team..haha!). The game was, in a word, BEAUTIFUL. And THAT is what footie fans wait for. Every season we have disappointments, ranging from "Oh no, we only won ONE trophy this season" to "Oh no, our club has been wound up for the cost of a top Premier League player's yearly salary". One day however, your chosen team will merit the song from the ever -faithful that goes something like "...it's just like watching Brazil..."

Today was not that Day. Chelski were all over us, 1st half, and why grown men take off their shirts to celebrate a goal is beyond me. One, it shows how nancyboy they are - blazing hot day, and Bollock was wearing a tee shirt under his team rag. He'd be mincemeat on a rugby pitch within 2 mins. And two, it's an automatic yellow card/booking/caution. Dumba55 pr1ck.

Second half, Ronaldo came on. For Rooney. Uh-huh, Fergie thnks that the Champions League is a bigger prize. He played like a pro should, unlike in mid-week. And should have had a penalty. True, but blahblah.

United like to win things the ultra-hard way, historically true to say. So, we will lift that trophy for a second consecutive year (Avram Grant SO does not deserve it...), but not today.

This was not proofread, and I hope my spelinlg [sic] is not too bad, in my giddy stupor.

Rambly rant over. Jxx

In case you missed the London Mayoral debate...

http://www.youtube.com/v/fKRJVBqvd04&hl=en

Quack quack!! This is great....
Zippy, or Bungle, or George
...who would get YOUR vote?

Haiku Duckie!! xx

...Rainbow ruderies... :)

Remember "Rainbow"?
I'll bet you wish this'd been shown
When you were younger...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c8zSl6A1CFE

- Haiku Duckie!! xx

Setting the world to lefts...

(It's a long one, this....)
You know how it is
Get so p155ed - then get inspired
To cure the world's ills
{Enough haiku already!}

You must all know that flash of inspiration that hits exactly when you are no fit state to remember it properly. So ...

1) You just forget it.
After all, it WAS in your brain, and everything stays there, waiting to re-emerge at some time in the future. Because it WAS there, it IS there and always WILL be there. Uh-huh...

2) You try and write something down.
Now, this is fun, because a lot of my life-shattering ideas used to come after I'd been on the sauce. My writing is bad at the best of times, bad enough for me to be a GP or in IT. Given my penchant for passing out at the sight of blood (especially my own...), the GP route was not open to me, but I DO have a degree in Economics and IT stuff, and had spent several years happily messing about with PCs, laptops, networks, intelligent users and thick-as-shit Directors.
Imagine how bad my scrawl would be, given that I would be 2 steps from unconsciousness as I tried to get the nib/lead/pointer to work on the paper/fag-packet/screen....
3) You tell someone on PAN to remind you in the morning.
Happened recently with a Friend, who said "
- Quote
Arse - once agaiin I figured out how to make the first million and by morning time forgot...It seemed like a brilliant idea at the time.. after a few beeros that is .. Next up - setting the world to rights..
...to which I haiku'd in reply
- Quote
"Set the world to rights"
Used to be my call
Shame that... - I am left-handed...
...and s/he then said
- Quote
Okay - Project "Set the World to lefts" is all yours - Good luck!

I recall it was to do with ducks. Obviously...

So here is Project Set The World TO Lefts. Do YOU, dear reader, recall any Bright Ideas that sprang to mnd, the fuzzy subject matter of which you recall, but buggered if you remember WHY, or WHAT it means, or HOW you even remember that much...?

I'll start...

Haiku maths

In this world of ours
Three types of people exist
Some CAN count, others CAN'T....

My Mother-in-law joke

We all know these... they go WAY back in time (RIP Les Dawson)
..."the penalty for bigamy is having two mothers-in-law"...
..."my mother in law was so ugly that..."
..."I took my mother-in-law round some Jaffa cakes..."

Well, my fave is this:

My mother-in-law came round last night.
I really must increase the dosage...

When llamas attack...

Fellow ducks and drakes
There is a new invasion
Llamas raise their heads

Have you noticed how the llamas are reproducing in droves on PAN? It can't ALL be the fruit of Dr Shallow's nefarious loins....

I myself became a llama yesterday for a minute or two until it was pointed out that I was a sheep. Duck, llama, sheep, this bird gets SO confused. I re-reverted to a duck. It felt safer...

Are we going to make a stand , or are we to be subsumed...?

QUACK QUACK!!!

Hot stuff in bed :)

You know when it's hot...
Can't wait to get to your bed
Someone waits for you

Lol

In my case it's Stephen King, or more accurately, Roland of Gilead. Having last year re-read the unofficial remake of Harry Trotter, written/plagiarised by someone called JK Rowling, I set off on another adventure...

Stephen King is the BEST storyteller, and almost ALL his oeuvres come together in his Dark Tower series. I am over half way through book 7 (the last one). Oh boy.... and I finally get to use THIS -> smiley properly!!

Anyone out there share this writer with me?

Duck botty

surprised all my fellow ducks did not do this earlier...
... yup, I am a duck's arse for today


Quack quack

Beware - dangerous spam alert...

No, seriously, this is not a con.

I get lots of crap emails daily - Canadian meds, penile enlargements, ¬£33million from an African prince, online gambling, yadda yadda yadda. And in a previous life I was in IT/network management, and had to deal with spam for a living (oh, I also had some infuriatingly dim users to shepherd too, but hey ho!)

This morning though, a very clever one. It was addressed to me proper formally as Mr [Initial] [lastname]
You don't need to know my name, so have changed it in the message to Mr H JakeyDuck....
It had a *.zip file attachment. I am not stupid enough to open an attached file from a stranger. Nor should you guys be. Warned, you are.

Dear Mr H JakeyDuck

This is Mark , how r been? I havn't hear from you in a very long time! Mary asked why didn't you come to our wedding? I was looking forward to see you there then I tried to call you several times but it seem you changed the number right ? is everything still okay with you ?
Here's some of the wedding pictures :

anthony2008.co.uk/picture/wedding .zip

Check it out and leave some comment for me . Miss u and hope to hear from you soon.

Mark and Mary

I do not know any couples by those names, my numbers have not altered in at least 10 years - including my mobby! - and I know if I had received a wedding invite! But it is very plausible, and it is human nature to take a peek at the piccies....

That's all, I gotta go hit the roads now, but all I can say is "be careful"
Jxx

The Number One record at your birth...

Now, I am ag√©d - the big 5-0 approacheth....
...Mrs Jakey had her 5-0 last weekend. Happens to a lot of us, it seems.

I discovered that the day she was born, the number one record in the charts was a female singist called Connie Francis, singing "Who's Sorry Now?".

Well, not me!

MY Number One, when I first drew in a lungful of God's clean air, was a classic too,

"Hoots Mon (as in 'there's a moose loose aboot this hoose')" by the Lord Rockingham XI

So I bought the two singles on eBay and framed them....

Question is this; using a search engine or the Guinness Book of Hit Singles, do you have a classic or a turkey as your own birthdate Number One?

Dare you tell?

Oh, and US or Irish charts are acceptable, if applicable
(Obviously Aussie charts ditto...in fact, whichever country bore you, provided they had pop charts...!!)
Jxx

Hot+pervy Action Man...? :-)

Recently watched the Team America:World Police fillum. (F*** yeah!!)
The hot puppet-on-puppet action reminded me of my formative teenage years.
Question. Am I the only person ever to have put Action Men and/or Barbie (et al) Dolls into compromising positions?

My worst memory is with two Action Men, one in a Chelsea strip, one in a Leeds outfit. Scoring....

Inglish as she is spoke...on Teletext

Germany (land of my fathers...) lost!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
And while waiting for the next match, I read the Teletext pages on ITN
Found this beaut....about Chelski's latest footie manager. Read it carefully out loud.

"Luiz Felipe Scolari's imperfect English will be not prevent him from getting his message across . . . "

Wonderful, and if you want to you it seeing [sic!], it's on Teletext page 411, page 1 of 5

Petrol rip-off in your area?

Has anyone out there seen evidence of blatant profiteering recently? Tell me here.
I have seen it. Check this out...
We live in an area north of Bristol (UK) called Yate.
It is known to be a rip-off for fuel - EVERY garage in Yate inflates the prices like a cartel, surrounding areas are all cheaper.
So I fill up 6 miles away when I go past a garage that is 3p cheaper.

Last Tuesday a TEXACO garage on the outskirts put unleaded up from ¬£1.18/ltr to ¬£1.21/ltr.
On Friday they increased its unleaded to ¬£1.25/ltr [all typos corrected, thanx Fazerider!]

7 pence a litre in 4 days. I make that over 30p a gallon up
Bastards. Unmitigated bastards. Anyone else had this problem- profiteering from the fuel crisis?

PAN vs SpyMace...

Tried to shout about how PAN is far better than MySpace.
I just got told that *Your shout was inappropriate and, thus, will not be shown.*

The shout was "F***ing MySpace, new layout and they lost my passwords, PAN rules!". Problem there?

So... does that mean that MySpace is in fact better than PAN?

Idiots.

Man-Flu

Oooh, I ache this morning. Head throbs, shoulders feel like they're in a vice, throat burns, limbs move under suffrance, face doesn't fit the front of my head...
...it's MAN FLU
I wonder how many mentypes suffer from this?
And how many ladytypes DON'T...?
A colleague said on Thursday that she tells her poorly hubby to just get on with it - she still washes and cooks when SHE is suffering.
I agreed with her totaly; when I get ill, I am happy to watch and croak too...

Bad Driving Habits.. tell me yours...

Well, I am fed up with the state of the UK's driving skills (haha). I will blog up the main points that piss ME off in the near future, but in case I miss any, let me know YOUR biggest pet hate in other drivers.

Not specifically (ie no "my wife drives like she is going to shatter if she reaches 20mph" sorta thing), but general traits. Like... Not indicating. Not giving way. Using mobby while driving. Outside lane hogs. Caravans.

I have my ideas, but so will you. Tell the Networld about it...

Brilliant French joke...

Yesterday I was reminded of a fab book I lost years ago. French Renaissance poetry. It was called "Mots d'Heure; Gousse, Rames". Whatever that means.
This is the first poem from the book; to paraphrase the great Rolf Harris, "Can you see what is is yet?"

"Un petit d'un petit
S'√©tonne aus Halles
Un petit d'un petit
Ah! degr√©s de folles
Un dol de qui ne sort cesse
Un dol de qui ne se m√®ne
Qu'importe un petit d'un petit
Tout Gai de Reguennes."

ps truly, I did have this book, and I miss it now...

Guitarist for hire

Looks like my current band has come to the end of its natural life. My keys wizard wants out, he's had enough of the effort too.

I'm an hairy , ag√©d Christian singing/songwriting rocker with a killer voice (compared to Robert Plant, no less), and I may just take a vacation from it all before deciding what to do....

1) Reform with new musos (not a nice move)
2) Join someone else's band (if they can handle me..)
3) Go solo (again)
4) Just become a recording artiste. (no gigging though)
5) Give up. (as if!!!)

Any ideas? Please, not #5 though!!!

J #8¬¨]//

PS option 6 - just replace him. Sorted!!!

My mother-in-law....

....bought me some new clothes and shoes for a most very big special family celebration next month. Well, Mrs Jakey bought them but her mum insistedon paying. Bless!

She told me on the phone that I'd be a real fart smeller...

...AND she meant it

As a Spoonerism. I was SO shocked. It was exactly like the old joke where a guy goes up to a female lovely and says "tickle your arse with a feather"...

Sorry, guys, I've been absent for a while

As the titel says, I've not really been pan.neting like wot I should.

The new terms well and truly kicked in, and I am again working until at least 9.00 every night.

Hurrah

I do have one bit of news. Steady yourself, Jan....

I'm getting my head totally SHAVED for Children in Need.

More on this (and how you can donate / sponsor) over the weekend

- ooh, no hair!

Jxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Hairy today, gone tomorrow...

Well, not tomorrow, but I have an update on my
HEAD SHAVE for Children in Need

The Beeb spurned my attempts to have it cut live, and I didn't think about having the shave BEFORE the Children in Need evening, so no tv for me D'oh

I have a date, time and location now, however.

SUNDAY NOVEMBER 16th

St Stephens Church HALL, Church Road, Soundwell, BRISTOL UK

at about 12.45pm. That's lunchtime, not midnight, btw!

You don't have to come to the church service beforehand, which ends just about 12.00, unless you feel moved...

...but it's be a chance to witness the Unveiling of the Scalp...

If you cannot get there, but are strangely compelled to donate to the cause, you can do it online too!
[b]www.justgiving.com/jakey will get you there.[/b]

Cheerz 4 reading!!

Jakey
Quack quack!

Happy Christmas!!!

Christmas Day greetings and hopes for you all to have the Christmas of your LIFE.

A most healing, peaceful, loving and safe Christmas to you all!

Jxxxxxx
